item.title: Too much time on KTDMS
item.description: So, quick poll: who else here can instinctively recognize the MD5 sum for 'password'?
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Upcoming geek events!
item.description:
Two (no, three) upcoming events in the moderately geeky circles.

CC Party at the Armchair

First up is the Creative Commons talk at the always great Armchair Theatre. I was going anyway as, well, I kind of live at the Armchair, but today in my inbox I found a very attractive invite, which I have reproduced below (click for a bigger version):

read more
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Everything is right in the world...
item.description:
...when women are growing nipples on their feet. Now doesn't that just give out a warm feeling inside? Or even outside.

In other news, please take a moment today to think about good ol' Ted Kaczynski, and his great The Unabomber Manifesto: Industrial Society and Its Future. Even if you don't necessarily agree with it. (Edit: ... as he was arrested on this day)
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: A Slightly More Grown-Up Social Networking Site
item.description:
I've never liked MySpace, for multiple reasons. It's horrible to look at, horribly coded, and feels vaguely like some puritan's apocalyptic vision of a society rapidly decomposing into a pile of maggoty fecal matter. That, of course, is just my opinion.

So when someone invited me to join Facebook the other day, I was hesitant - aren't all of these social sites pretty much the same? Apparently not.

read more
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Uh, stuff and things
item.description:
I was going to post something about the geekdinner, and, after that, a long rant about cigarettes, addiction, drugs, politics, and friends long dead, but it won't happen tonight. Instead I want to paste in something I wrote about four years ago for Africans.co.za called Tetris!:

read more
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: I am Bryn's utter lack of blog posts
item.description:
I keep being reminded that I'm not writing enough. But good news! I'm not doing anything else I'm supposed to be doing either! That should make for something.

Got quite a bit of work which has been waiting around for ages - building a micro-finance application on top of KnowledgeTree. It's semi-interesting: mainly revolves around roles and workflows, but also uses the document content to store JSON serialized info with has been gathered via a number of forms. But that's not going too well, due to time and motivational restraints.

read more
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Phrase of the Day
item.description:
Googleright
If it's on the Internet, it's ours.
Thanks to Neil for yelling 'Move right' while I was thinking about copyright.
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Phrase of the Day
item.description: <dl> <dt>Colon Code</dt> <dd>Code which is not only as stupidly twisted as spaghetti code, but which is also full of shit.</dd> </dl>
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: A few quick notes
item.description:
Yes! I've finally begun the re-skinning. This is an in-progress operation! Do not be wowed by the frequent breaks! Do not open in Internet Explorer!

Additionally, the spam started yesterday (which is a good thing, right?), so there's an extra field on the comment forms which must not be filled! In fact, I insist that you do not provide the requested information. The field will disappear into the background soon.

That concludes this broadcast. Return to your workbenches.
item.dc:creator: bryn

item.title: Negativeland
item.description:
Damn, this blog is tending rapidly towards the negative. I think this is due, at least in part, to the fact that I've written nothing except academic essays and program documentation for the last few year; there was a time when even my most negative rantings had a sense of subtlety and humour which made them entertaining. I've gotta find my way back there.

My next post will probably be on consolidating this fast-blooming field of Javascript frameworks, a topic which I will attempt to approach with joy, variety, sublime prose, and a built-in laugh track. Have a good evening, all!
item.dc:creator: bryn
